result.execSummary:
The defendant William John Bartlett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: *Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA and attorney fees to the probation agent, cash bail to apply. Any missing payments and/or any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.

*NO violent contact with victim or any family members.
*May NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.

*Participate in AODA and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: *Successfully complete 20 hours of community service with a non-profit organization.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William John Bartlett

defendant.name: Bartlett, William John
defendant.address: 803  Carrington Avenue, Lower, South Milwaukee, WI 53172

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $294.00 entered as ordered by the court on 11/23/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 07/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and distributed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:
Defendant sentenced to serve 5 months (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for zero days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:    
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Successfully complete family counseling.
     *   No violent contact with victim or any family members.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA and attorney fees
           to the probation agent, cash bail to apply. 
          Any missing payments and/or any remaining balance at  
          the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of
          an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Successfully complete 20 hours of community
          service with a non-profit organization.
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.

Defendant William John Bartlett in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant William John Bartlett in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Appointing Attorney Dennis Thornton signed and filed.

Defendant William John Bartlett in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant just got out of custody a few days ago.  Does not qualifiy for public defender representation.  Indigency hearing conducted.  Court finds defendant qualifies for representation at County expense and has the ability to repay the county at the rate of $50.00 per month upon conclusion of this case.  Court appoints Attorney Dennis Thornton, who accepts the appointment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Oral No Violent Contact Order with: Kristi W. Tabitha B.  
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William John Bartlett in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant William John Bartlett in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  
UPON RELEASE FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
